subject: Nutrition
title: Fat as Fuel
description: A micro-lesson that makes Fat as Fuel usable.

hook.text: Even the leanest athlete stores 40,000 calories as fatâ€”enough to run 20 marathons without eating.

buildup.text: Fat is an enormous energy reserve, but the body only burns it efficiently at lower exercise intensities.

discovery.text: Training at lower intensities improves fat oxidation, teaching your body to spare precious glycogen.

twist.text: Ultra-runners now use high-fat diets to extend endurance beyond what glycogen alone allows.

climax.text: Fat adaptation takes weeks of training. It boosts endurance but sacrifices top-end sprint speed.

punchline.text: Your body carries marathon fuel. Training teaches it to burn.

quiz.question: How many calories does the leanest athlete store as fat?
